title: Transformations

title: Equation
text: Think about the equation in the form of $${\left(a \left(x+b\right)\right)}^2+k$$

title: Vertical Transformation
text: Which variable represents the vertical transformation?
speech: Which variable represents the vertical transformation?
pacedSpeech: Which variable represents the vertical transformation?

title: Vertical Transformation
text: Since k represents the vertical transformation, what is k in our case?
speech: Since k represents the vertical transformation, what is k in our case?

title: Vertical Transformation
text: Since our k is $$-7$$, is this a vertical shift up or down?
speech: Since our k is  minus 7 , is this a vertical shift up or down?
pacedSpeech: Since our k is   minus 7
, is this a vertical shift up or down?

title: Down Transformation
text: It is a vertical shift down by $$7$$, since our k is $$-7$$.

, since our k is   negative 7

title: Width
text: Which variable represents the width of our graph?

title: Width
text: Since a is $$\frac{1}{3}$$, what does that tell us about the width? Will it be skinnier, wider, or normal?
speech: Since a is  1 third , what does that tell us about the width? Will it be skinnier, wider, or normal?

title: Wide Width
text: Since a is $$\frac{1}{3}$$, which has an absolute value less than $$1$$, it will have a wider width.
speech: Since a is  1 third , which has an absolute value less than  1 , it will have a wider width.

title: Direction

title: Up
